text: Is there a package that will save objects? For example I have an `Array` of ODE solutions that took some time to build. I would like to save this data object as a file so that I don't have to run my time-consuming simulations everytime. I think this process is called serialization, but I am not sure. I think `R` has something similar with `readRDS` and `saveRDS` functions

text: Can we cross post this publicly to <https://discourse.julialang.org|Discourse> for further visibility? React with :bridge: on the message above to approve. <https://github.com/JuliaCommunity/SlackBridge/blob/main/README.md#faq|More info here>
JLD2.jl (l<https://github.com/JuliaIO/JLD2.jl|ink>) will serialize and deserialize arbitrary julia data.

elements.text: ) will serialize and deserialize arbitrary julia data.

text: Julia also has serialization facilities in its standard library (<https://docs.julialang.org/en/v1/stdlib/Serialization/|link>), although I never see anyone using them... not sure why :shrug: .

elements.text: Julia also has serialization facilities in its standard library (
), although I never see anyone using them... not sure why

text: Also, you can just use Serialization from the stdlib

elements.text: Also, you can just use Serialization from the stdlib

text:
>  although I never see anyone using them... not sure why :shrug:
it can be really fragile; I've seen cases where deserialization fails if there are more/fewer anonymous functions in the deserialization environment than the serialization one (even if you aren't serializing/deserializing those anonymous functions!). And you often can't change Julia versions, or sometimes even package versions.

elements.text: although I never see anyone using them... not sure why

And you often can't change Julia versions, or sometimes even package versions.

text: it's designed for inter-process communication and it works well for that, but not necessarily long-lived data
